Name: Fragment of a statue of a sitting king
Description: This fragment of a statue was found by the belgian archaeologists at Elkab in front of the first pylon of the temple of the goddess Nekhbet. It's probably  the king Thuthmosis III, seated, dressed in a short pleated kilt. A single inscription has been preserved; it is found just to the side of the left leg of the king, on the front side of the throne, and contains his "son of Re name".
